xmldoc.short_description: Pole assignment for a given matrix pair (A,B).

syntax.syntax_item: [A_OUT, WR_OUT, WI_OUT, NFP, NAP, NUP, F, Z, IWARN, INFO] = slicot_sb01bd(DICO, ALPHA, A_IN, B_IN, WR_IN, WI_IN, TOL)

param_input_item.param_description: Specifies the type of the original system.'C': continuous-time system;'D': discrete-time system.
the leading N-by-N part of this array must contain the state dynamics matrix A.
The leading N-by-M part of this array must contain the input/state matrix.
contains the real parts of the desired eigenvalues of the closed-loop system state-matrix A+B*F.
contains the imaginary parts of the desired eigenvalues of the closed-loop system state-matrix A+B*F.
The absolute tolerance level below which the elements of A or B are considered zero (used for controllability tests).

param_output_item.param_description: the leading N-by-N part of this array contains the matrix Z'*(A+B*F)*Z in a real Schur form.
if INFO = 0, the leading NAP elements of these arrays contain the real parts of the assigned eigenvalues. The trailing NP-NAP elements contain the unassigned eigenvalues.
if INFO = 0, the leading NAP elements of these arrays contain the imaginary parts of the assigned eigenvalues. The trailing NP-NAP elements contain the unassigned eigenvalues.
The number of eigenvalues of A having real parts less than ALPHA, if DICO = 'C', or moduli less than ALPHA, if DICO = 'D'. These eigenvalues are not modified by the eigenvalue assignment algorithm.
The number of assigned eigenvalues. If INFO = 0 on exit, then NAP = N-NFP-NUP.
The number of uncontrollable eigenvalues detected by the eigenvalue assignment algorithm.
The leading M-by-N part of this array contains the state feedback F, which assigns NAP closed-loop eigenvalues and keeps unaltered N-NAP open-loop eigenvalues.
The leading N-by-N part of this array contains the orthogonal matrix Z which reduces the closed-loop system state matrix A + B*F to upper real Schur form.
= 0: no warning; = K: K violations of the numerical stability condition.

description.p: To determine the state feedback matrix F for a given system (A,B) such that the closed-loop state matrix A+B*F has specified eigenvalues.
